Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat and label it.
The student can draw and label other plants or animals that might live in the same or nearby area.
The student can label essential needs such as water, air, and food resources in the drawing.
The student can represent the relationship between the fish and the water it needs to survive.
The student can label the resources the habitat provides to the fish.
The student can identify and label how the fish and resources work together as part of a system.
